text: Tun Tun Nyi (; ; born Myanmar) is a Burmese military officer who served as the vice chairman of the Tatmadaw True News Information Team, the media and public relations group of the Tatmadaw (Myanmar military). He was known as a spokesperson for the military during major events like the 2021 military coup. == Early life and education == Not much is known about Tun Tun Nyi's early life or education. It is believed that he studied at the Defence Services Academy, like many senior officers in the military. == Military career == Tun Tun Nyi served in the Myanmar Army and became a major general. Around 2018, he was appointed vice chairman of the Tatmadaw True News Information Team. In this role, he often appeared at press conferences to explain the military’s position on political and military events. == Role in military media == As vice chairman, Tun Tun Nyi helped defend the military’s actions, especially after the Rohingya conflict in 2017 and the 2021 military coup. He often appeared alongside military spokesperson Major General Zaw Min Tun. After the coup, the media team became less active. == Personal life == There is little public information about Tun Tun Nyi’s personal life. == References == Category:Burmese military people Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing Category:Pages created with the Article Wizard from 2025
